docs.snippet: DEATH OF THE KENTUCKY GIANT. - James D. Porter, well known as the "Kentucky Giant, " though born at Portsmouth, Ohio, was found dead in his bed at his residence, near Louisville, on Monday, April 25. He was 19 years of age, seven feet nine inches in...
docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH OF THE KENTUCKY GIANT. - James D. Porter, well known as the "Kentucky Giant, " though born at Portsmouth, Ohio, was found dead in his bed at his residence, near Louisville, on Monday, April 25. He was 19 years of age, seven feet nine inches in height, and when in good health weighed three hundred pounds.

docs.snippet: WHO KILLED THE HEALTH BILL? -Gen. PROSPER M. WETMORE, at the last meeting of the City Sanitary Association , pulled aside the curtain, and let the world look in upon the death-Scene of the late Health bill.
docs.lead_paragraph: WHO KILLED THE HEALTH BILL? -Gen. PROSPER M. WETMORE, at the last meeting of the City Sanitary Association , pulled aside the curtain, and let the world look in upon the death-Scene of the late Health bill.

headline.main: NEW-YORK SANITARY ASSOCIATION.; General Wetmore Explains How the Health Bill was Lost--Plain Talk About Mayor Tiemann, the Hon. C. S. Spencer and Clerk Richardson--Report of the Legislative Committee.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New-York Sanitary Association held a meeting at the Cooper Institute on Thursday evening, April 21, when the Committee on Legislation at Albany made a verbal report through Mr. PROSPER M. WETMORE, one of the Committee, who has been untiring in his efforts to obtain the passage of the Health bill.

docs.snippet: Interesting Debate on the Contagion of Yellow Fever--Remarks of Drs. Francis, Stevens, Snow and Others--A Magnificent Banquet. The Convention reassembled at the College of Physicians and Surgeons, (Twenty-third street, corner of Fourth-avenue,) at 10...

headline.main: QUARANTINE AND SANITARY CONVENTION.; Important Quarantine Modifications Recommended. Third Annual Session--Third Day's Proceedings.

docs.lead_paragraph: Interesting Debate on the Contagion of Yellow Fever--Remarks of Drs. Francis, Stevens, Snow and Others--A Magnificent Banquet. The Convention reassembled at the College of Physicians and Surgeons, (Twenty-third street, corner of Fourth-avenue,) at 10 A.M. of Friday. The President announced two delegates from Canada as present, Drs. OTTAR and MORAN.

docs.snippet: We read in a French paper : "A few days since took place the funeral of a vivandiere belonging to one of the regiments of the Garde Imperiale. The coffin was covered with a black pall, on which was embroidered a white orucrfix. On the bier were...
docs.lead_paragraph: We read in a French paper : "A few days since took place the funeral of a vivandiere belonging to one of the regiments of the Garde Imperiale. The coffin was covered with a black pall, on which was embroidered a white orucrfix. On the bier were placed her military coat and red petticoat, a poignard, and a stoall round bat ornamented with a plume of feathers.

headline.main: QUARANTINE AND SANITARY CONVENTION; Third Annual Meeting -- Second Day's Proceedings. Is Quarantine a Humbug? -- Interesting Debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The second day of the Sessions Quarantine Convention was still more interesting than the first. The Lecture-room of the College of Physicians and Surgeons did not present a very crowded attendance at the hour of opening, (10 A. M.,) several carriage-leads of delegates having accepted the invitation to unite in the Brooklyn Water Celebration; but by 11 A. M. the attendance was large.
